results.content: Very clear, video well done, coherent format. I think students should be directed toward Moodle Documentation more. There were a couple things which seemed like a "way" to get a task done, but not the "moodle way" For instance, when pulling an array, we should have used $DB->get_records_list() instead of running $DB->get_records_select() within a loop. But, it was a good introduction and I can see a lot of work went into the class.
results.content_html: Very clear, video well done, coherent format. I think students should be directed toward Moodle Documentation more. There were a couple things which seemed like a "way" to get a task done, but not the "moodle way" For instance, when pulling an array, we should have used $DB->get_records_list() instead of running $DB->get_records_select() within a loop. But, it was a good introduction and I can see a lot of work went into the class.

response.content:
Moodle Team,
I would love to get a better rating from the Moodle Team! I see why that music might be distracting so I have removed it from videos 5 and 18 in this course, and from three of my other courses over this weekend.

Also, I am curious what you find inaccurate about the course description. Please let me know so I can address it! 
-Brian

results.content: Está muy bien explicado. Solo echo en falta más clases con más detalles de personalización (meter imágenes, posicionar el bloque, personalizar el tamaño...).
results.content_html: Está muy bien explicado. Solo echo en falta más clases con más detalles de personalización (meter imágenes, posicionar el bloque, personalizar el tamaño...).

results.content:
I had some preexisting knowledge about programming in PHP and managing Moodle because I've already set up and used some Moodle instances. That helped a lot understanding the course in the first run. All concepts were appropriately presented so even a beginner should be able to follow along. The presentation is precise and calm and doesn't scare a novice with too many technical vocabulary. And the audio is simply great! Well pronounced and easy to understand even if you're no native english speaker.

Thank you very much, you helped me quite a bit to integrate some internal logic of the company into the Moodle platform we use.
results.content_html:

And the audio is simply great! Well pronounced and easy to understand even if you're no native english speaker.

Thank you very much, you helped me quite a bit to integrate some internal logic of the company into the Moodle platform we use.

results.content: Very detailed course. Would have loved a second part of the course with more advance lessons to be able to continue learning about moodle block developement. But overall a great course, great teacher.

results.content: The course was good, I want to learn to make an activity plugin, but this course help to put me on context and figure out how can moodle works
results.content_html: The course was good, I want to learn to make an activity plugin, but this course help to put me on context and figure out how can moodle works

results.content:
This course was fantastic. I am a beginner, I have only studied a little bit of Python, but I have more than 15 years of experience as  a user in Moodle and this is exactly what I was looking for. The course is super clear.
One thing I missed however, is how to prevent students to add the block to their own dashboard. I think that I will remove the "user" myadd capability and leave only the roles I want, but it would have been nice to make that a little clearer as my goal is to produce reports for faculty staff, not for students or instructors. But super great. Very glad I took this course.
results.content_html:

results.content: I'm finding it extremely difficult to focus on the content with the music (which is entirely inappropriate and unmixed relative to the voice track). To be honest I'm really struggling to listen to the content without getting a headache. I am skipping past content until the music has stopped and I am missing content that I simply cannot consume with the background racket.. I will continue for another while as I really need this information but I may have to request a refund if the content is un-useable i.e. not able to digest it due to the highly distracting audio / music tracks. As a suggestion: perhaps the music and fanfare section intro's could be removed? they are not necessary and quite frankly detract from the otherwise good main content.
